text:
Aroma: banana and cloves.
Appearance: hazy golden color and creamy head.
Taste: cloves, banana, sweet notes, sticky, warming alkohol, semi-sweet.
Palate: full body and medium carbonation.
Overall: Really interesting beer, something like an imperial weizenbock.

L:
-pours a cloudy golden-orange with a small to medium,frothy,offwhite head
-medium to high carbonation visible
S:
-Honey,Banana,Clove,slight Grapefruit
T:
-Follows the nose+ grainy
-medium to high bitterniss for the style
F:
-medium to high carbonation
-medium body
-alcohol noticeable
O:
This needed a ,lot more bitterniss to balance out the sweetness.
It is a beefed-up Bernstein-Weizen.

Huge thanks to WillemsUrenkel for that one! Bottle looks interesting. Beer in the glass zippy, nice head. Starts intense malty-yeasty, light alcoholic hints, but the high ABV is well hidden. Fruity notes of apricot, some banana. Modest sweet. Finish strong, bit more alcoholic. Dangerous - the beer is quite drinkable. Not bad!

UPDATED: JUN 1, 2017 Aus der Flasche getrunken (Direktlieferung aus der Brauerei). Fast klares Amber im Glas mit stabile weißer Schaumkrone. Feine Bananentöne. Im Nachtrunk leicht spicy. Kaum Hefelast.
Ungewöhnlich gewöhnlich. Bananamann mit wohlig wärmenden Kräuterbody.....0,1 vom Fass in der ELBPHILHARMONIE HH:

22-02-17 // bottle at home. Cloudy orange beer with solid white head. Nose of ripe bananas. Taste is yeasty, loads of ripe sweet bananas. The ABV of 9.5 is well hidden, good balanced. I cant taste Eisbock here but its nice. Light hoppy bitter finish.
Sampled @ BKL 2017. Trübes orange goldenes Bier mit einer geringen beigen Schaumkrone. Geruch nach reifen süßen Bananen. Geschmack ist süß bananig, hefig, leicht alkoholisch, naja.
Golden to orange colour. Intense aroma and taste of wheat, yeast and bananas. Full-bodied, medium carbonation. Well hidden alcohol. Some hints of citrus and pineapple at the finish. Nice one.

0.33 l bottle from the brewerys web shop, best before October 2018. Clear, golden amber with a medium large, foamy, stable, off-white head. Sweetish, yeasty-spicy and slightly fruity aroma of banana, cloves, pear, bubblegum and some dried apricot. Moderately sweet, rather yeasty-spicy and slightly fruity taste of banana, lots of cloves, pear, dried apricot and some bubblegum, followed by a medium long, very yeasty and a bit peppery-spicy finish. Medium to full body, creamy and quite effervescent mouthfeel, average carbonation. Impressive beer, not that easy to drink, but I like the typical and very pronounced Weizen flavours.
Bottle. Hazy orange color with white head. Aroma is bananas, Gletschereis, cream. Taste is bananas, cream, a bit grassy. Medium carbonation. Okay.
Pours an orange color. Aroma is light to moderate malty, wheat, fruity malt, moderate to light heavy yeasty, sweet yeasty, fruity. A good Weizenbock!
330ml Flasche. Orangefarben und naturtrüb mit großer Schaumkrone. Intensives Hefearoma. Kräftig. Alkohol stark schmeckbar. Erfrischend mit mildem Abklang.
